articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Palestinian Chief
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Palestinian Chief
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday sent a message of greetings to Mahmoud Abbas, Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of the proclamation of the State of Palestine.
					 Kim Yong Nam in his message expressed belief that the Palestinian people would surely win victory in their just cause of regaining the legitimate national rights including the right to self-determination, the right to return to the homeland and the right to establish an independent state with Kuds as its capital.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Mozambican President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Mozambican President 
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Armando Emilio Guebuza on his reelection as President of Mozambique.
					Kim in the message noted that the Korean people are pleased with the big progress and development made by the people of Mozambique in the socio-economic field under the leadership of the President.
					
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too, he wished the President success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Congratulates Lebanese PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Congratulates Lebanese PM
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, on Friday sent a congratulatory message to Saad Hariri on his appointment as Prime Minister of Lebanon.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him success in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Ali Shami on the same day on his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Immigrants.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Mongolian FM 
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Friday sent a congratulatory message to Gombojab Zandanshatar on his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia.
					 The message expressed the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future and sincerely wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Chinese Figure on Stronger Sino-DPRK Relations
articles.content:
Chinese Figure on Stronger Sino-DPRK Relations
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- I was deeply impressed to visit the DPRK, said Luo Dihui, standing vice-secretary of the Party Committee of the National Tourism Administration who visited the DPRK at the head of a friendship visiting group of China. 
					 He went on to say:
					
					 The Korean people are making a dynamic drive to open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 We are pleased to learn that the Korean people have achieved big successes in socialist construction under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people's inexhaustible mental power deeply impressed us. 
					
					 Both China and the DPRK are the friendly neighbors linked with the same mountain and rivers. 
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship has a long history and tradition.  
					
					 Kim Il Sung provided the friendship between the two countries together with revolutionaries of the elder generation of China including Chairman Mao Zedong and Premier Zhou Enlai.
					
					 The armies and peoples of the two countries fought shoulder to shoulder in the period of the anti-Japanese war and the Korean War, winning shining victories. 
					
					 The two countries have hastened socialist construction, supporting and cooperating with each other.
					
					 It is a noble duty for the two peoples to steadily consolidate and develop their friendly and cooperative relations. 
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship is favorably developing with each passing day under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 Exchange and cooperation are brisk between the two countries. 
					
					 He expressed the conviction that the Sino-DPRK friendship would last forever.

articles.title: DPRK's Effort to Solve Food Problem
articles.content:
DPRK's Effort to Solve Food Problem
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Today is the anniversary of the DPRK's entry into the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.
					 Since the DPRK was founded over six decades ago, it has made sustained efforts to attain food self-sufficiency.
					
					 Since its admission to the FAO in Juche 66 (1977) the DPRK has closely cooperated with the organization in its efforts for increasing food and agricultural production on a world-wide scale so as to improve the dietary life and eliminate starvation in each country.
					
					 Officials of ministries and national institutions did the first Friday-labor for this year on co-op fields. To begin with, the co-op farms throughout the country registered signal successes in the farming preparations such as producing and transporting compost, carpeting field with humus soil and repairing and readjusting of farm machines.
					
					In particular, the continuous on-the-spot guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to co-op farms including the Tongbong Co-op Farm in Hamju County, fertilizer and agrochemicals production bases, Wonsan University of Agriculture and others has served as a powerful driving force of the agricultural development.
					
					 The gasification projects in Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and Hungnam Fertilizer Complex which were visited by the leader show the firm will of the Korean people to solve food problem by themselves without fail by establishing a Juche-oriented fertilizer production method. Thanks to their will, a new agrochemicals production process has been built in the February 8 Vinalon Complex and a gigantic waterway stretched out across the Miru Plain.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly solve the food problem, the agricultural problem by surmounting the bottlenecks and difficulties lying on the way for increasing grain production and thus make a positive contribution to the building of a new peaceful and prosperous world.

articles.title: Poem and Song Performance  Held
articles.content:
Poem and Song Performance Held
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A poem and song performance of schoolchildren was given at the Central Youth Hall on Friday to mark the 55th publication anniversary of General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il's famous masterpiece "I Wish a Second Would Become an Hour."
					Recited at the stage of performance was "I Wish a Second Would Become an Hour", a poem written by Kim Jong Il in the period of the postwar reconstruction, wishing good health to President
						 Kim Il Sung who was tirelessly working without sparing himself.
					
					 Put on the stage were chorus "We Wish Good Health to the General", trio poem "Every Second and Every Hour of Yearning", poem and female chorus "If It Is the Wall Clock in the General's Office" and other numbers.
					
					 Among them were Oungum ensemble "Sound of the General's Footsteps", poem and Kayagum ensemble "Chollima of Songun Korea Runs at Full Gallop" and chorus "Letter of Blessing Presented by Three Millions of Schoolchildren".
					
					In those numbers the performers represented the joy and happiness of the schoolchildren, who are growing up stoutly while learning to their hearts' content with their great hopes under the care of
						 Kim Jong Il, and their will to prepare themselves as the masters of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Central Botanical Garden
articles.content:
Central Botanical Garden
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Central Botanical Garden called magazine of vegetation is located at the foot of picturesque Mt. Taesong in Pyongyang.
					 The botanical garden with 50-year-long history covers several hundreds of hectares.
					
					 It has the International Friendship Greenhouse, the Plant Museum, districts for gift plants, gift fruit-bearing trees, garden and scenic forest, vegetation and for introducing plants of economic value, arboretum, herbary and others.
					
					Thousands of species of gift plants presented to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary
						 Kim Jong Il by progressive people of the five continents and overseas Koreans are preserved, cultivated and propagated as national treasures at the International Friendship Greenhouse and the districts for gift plants and gift fruit-bearing trees.
					
					 Growing in the greenhouse of Plant Museum, a leading base for disseminating plant knowledge, are more than 1,000 tropical plants of over 260 species.
					
					 Over 10,000 trees of 128 species take roots in well-arranged arboretum and medicinal herbs of some 400 species in the herbary.
					
					 The botanical garden serves as a breeding farm of Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, the flowers praising the great men. It has researched and completed the tissue culture method of the immortal flowers and succeeded in nursing Kimjongilia on open-air garden in the northern area of Korea like Taehongdan.
					
					 The Kimilsungia Hothouse under the botanical garden has propagated 80,000-odd Kimilsungia plants to nearly 1,500 units of Korea and hundreds of Kimilsungia plants to over 30 countries for the last 20-odd years.
					
					 It was not long before that the botanical garden started to cultivate Kimjongilia. But it has rapidly spread the flower to more than 20 countries, to say nothing of Korea.
					
					 Scientists in the districts for garden and scenic forest, vegetation and for introducing plants of economic value have deepened researches into the trees of economic value to increase their species, raise their productivity and widely propagate them to the whole country.
					
					 The Central Botanical Garden is strengthening scientific and technological exchange with botanical gardens in all provinces of Korea and some 100 botanical gardens of foreign countries, thus making a positive contribution to turning the country into wooded gardens and forests.

articles.title: Full Play to Spirit of Self-Reliance and Fortitude Called for
articles.content:
Full Play to Spirit of Self-Reliance and Fortitude Called for
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday editorially calls upon all the people to wage a dynamic drive for winning victory in the 100-day campaign under the uplifted banner of self-reliance, single-mindedly united around the headquarters of the revolution headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The mental power to display self-reliance and fortitude serves as a powerful ideological and moral weapon for the Korean people who have covered a victorious and glorious road under the steersmanship of the great leader and the great party, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 Very vast is our task to reach the high eminence of a thriving nation and there are not a few things in short supply for us. But there is nothing impossible for us when we undertake everything, believing in our own efforts. 
					
					 We have the single-minded unity as all the people are united as one around the party, the mental power strong enough to turn everything  impossible into something possible, the advantageous socialist system and the firm foundation of the self-supporting economy that has grown solid despite stern trials. We can proudly enter the gate to a thriving nation when we work our own way, giving full play to our political and ideological might and relying on our economic potential.
					
					 The on-going 100-day campaign is the last charge to glorify this year as a year of the great turn to be specially recorded in the nation's history. Its great significance lies in that it is an offensive to win a greater victory in the next year, the 65th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea, and lay a springboard from which to enter the gate to a thriving nation in 2012. There is no other way but to rely on our own efforts in order to bring about a turning point in the drive for building a thriving nation this year without fail. Self-reliance guarantees a victory in the on-going general offensive and a rosy future of a thriving nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's faith in independence, rare grit and persevering spirit of forced march serve as an engine encouraging the servicepersons and the people of the DPRK to display the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude to the fullest extent, concludes the editorial.

articles.title: Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
articles.content:
Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- It is a pressing task facing the Korean nation at present to improve the inter-Korean relations, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself", and inject fresh energy into the movement for national reunification. Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a signed article.
					 It says:
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself" is pervaded with the spirit of independence.
					
					 It is the Koreans who ardently desire national reunification and have the strength and will to achieve it. The issue of reunification can be successfully solved only by the concerted efforts of the Koreans as it is their internal affair in every respect. 
					
					 Only when the north and the south pool will and intention for the sake of reunification and reenergize the cooperation and exchange in line with the common interests and demand of the nation, is it possible to pave the way for national reunification irrespective of the differing ideology and system. 
					
					 All the Koreans at home and overseas have striven hard to implement the north-south declarations despite the obstructions on the part of the separatist forces inside and outside south Korea. This clearly testifies to the tremendous attraction and vitality of the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 It is beyond any doubt that a wide avenue will be opened for independent reunification, peace and prosperity when the inter-Korean relations are definitely converted into the ties aimed at national reunification in the spirit of "By our nation itself".
					
					 South Korea should make a switchover in its anachronistic policy of confrontation towards compatriots, defuse confrontation and tension by pursuing a policy of alliance and reconciliation with the north and take practical measures for radically improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 All Koreans desirous of national reunification should intensify the patriotic struggle for reunification, solidarizing and uniting with each other in the idea of "By our nation itself" irrespective of the differing ideology, system, political view and religious faith, urges the article.

articles.title: South-South Cooperation Called for
articles.content:
South-South Cooperation Called for
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The South-South cooperation provides developing countries with one of the basic ways to overcome the present difficulties and establish a new fair and equal international economic order, observes  Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The boosted South-South cooperation makes it possible to put an end to the imperialists' neo-colonial exploitation and plunder and bring about a fundamental switchover in the economic relations with the developed countries. 
					
					 Of course, the developing countries still have a lot of weak points in their economies. But when they boost mutual cooperation and exchange on the principle of collective self-reliance, their economies will remarkably grow stronger and this will give impetus to the establishment of the new international economic order and the economic development in the developing countries. 
					
					 The boosted South-South cooperation will help the developing countries increase their might and roles as it will contribute to strengthening friendship and unity among them. 
					
					 The relations among the developing countries will become closer than ever before if they boost cooperation and exchange in different fields, complementing one another. 
					
					 If the developing countries unite close politically, closely cooperating with one another in economy and technology on the above-said principle and thus stand up against the old international economic order through their joint struggle, the imperialists will find themselves in a tight corner as they cannot survive without exploiting and plundering the above-mentioned countries and this will create a favorable environment for establishing a new international economic order. 
					
					 The more positively the developing countries boost the South-South cooperation, the faster the process for establishing the new international economic order will become and the more  rapidly their struggle for independent development and prosperity will advance in the new century, concludes the article.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK War Maneuvers Assailed
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK War Maneuvers Assailed
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations of south Korea held the 122nd anti-U.S. solidarity rally in Seoul on Nov. 10 and denounced the warlike forces for their war moves against the DPRK.
					 The speakers at the rally recalled that in recent years the U.S. staged all kinds of war maneuvers including Hoguk with the south Korean warlike forces to test new-type weapons for invading the DPRK and, at the same time, rounded off the "OPLAN 5029" the core of which is to "cope with emergency situation in the north".
					
					 They charged that the "OPLAN 5029" is a war plan in contravention of even international laws and it is aimed at invading the DPRK by hurling huge troops including those for special warfare and the marines.
					
					 They warned that they would never pardon the U.S. for having rounded off the plan for aggression on the DPRK despite its lip-service for "dialogue" with the DPRK and infringing upon the interests of the south Korean people to meet its own interests.
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its unjust hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for concluding a peace accord on the Korean Peninsula and withdrawing the U.S. forces from south Korea, they urged.

articles.title: Repeal of Japan's Hostile Policy toward DPRK Urged
articles.content:
Repeal of Japan's Hostile Policy toward DPRK Urged
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Representatives of civic organizations in Osaka, Kyoto and Hyogo of Japan on Oct. 29 staged an action of urging the authorities to make a switchover in Japan's hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 In the letter of request addressed to the Japanese prime minister the organizations called for conveying the willingness to resume Japan-DPRK talks to the DPRK, immediately lifting the ban on international mail delivery and opposing the "special measures bill allowing inspections of sea and air cargo traveling to and from north Korea".
					
					 The co-representative of the Solidarity of Citizens in Osaka Prefecture Demanding Earlier Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK, the permanent director of the Japan-DPRK Friendship Kyoto Net for Promoting Cultural and Scientific Interchange among Citizens and the director of the Hyogo Prefectural People's Council for Japan-DPRK Friendship submitted letters of request calling for settling the issues between the two countries through dialogue, not by sanctions, and urgent letters of request calling for repeal of the said bill to the Ministry of National Land and Communications, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Cabinet Office and urged those concerned to opt for sincere implementation of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.

articles.title: International Meeting of Christians Held in Hong Kong
articles.content:
International Meeting of Christians Held in Hong Kong 
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- An international meeting of Christians on peace, reconciliation and reunification on the Korean Peninsula was held in Hong Kong from Oct. 21 to 23.
					 It brought together the delegations of the World Council of Churches, the Christian Conference of Asia and the Christian Federation of Korea and other delegations and delegates from 28 countries including Laos, India, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand, Japan, Canada, the U.S., Germany, Britain, France, Switzerland and Kenya.
					
					 The meeting expressed deep concern about the grave situation prevailing on the peninsula due to the evermore undisguised hostile acts of the U.S., Japan and the south Korean authorities towards the DPRK and discussed the measures to intensify the international solidarity movement of the Christian organizations.
					
					 The communique adopted at the meeting said that the Korean people, a homogenous nation, are still undergoing sufferings from the artificial division caused by foreign forces. The inter-Korean relations that favorably developed amid the atmosphere of reconciliation and cooperation in line with the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration have deteriorated to an extreme pitch of tension due to the recent wrong moves of the south Korean authorities against the DPRK and the peninsula is exposed to a grave military danger owing to the reckless hostile policies of the U.S. and Japan towards it, it noted, and went on:
					
					 Christian organizations in various countries should intensify the international solidarity movement for the full implementation of the said declarations, the lifting of all the sanctions imposed upon the DPRK according to the resolution of the UN Security Council, support to the proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula, the resumption of the DPRK-U.S. talks, the improvement of the DPRK-Japan relations, the drop of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK, stop to the military exercises in south Korea and its vicinity and the building of a nuclear-free world.

articles.title: Luo Dihui se compromete a desarrollar relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Luo Dihui se compromete a desarrollar relaciones con Corea
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El subsecretario permanente del Comite del Partido de la Administracion Nacional de Turismo, Luo Dihui, quien preside el grupo chino de visita de amistad a Corea, dijo que estuvo profundamente impresionado durante su permanencia aqui y prosiguio:
					  El pueblo coreano lucha dinamicamente por abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera en 2012, ano del centenario del nacimiento del estimado Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  Estamos contentos de los grandes exitos que bajo la guia del gran camarada Kim Jong Il el pueblo coreano logra en la construccion del socialismo.
					
					  Nos conmovio mucho la indoblegable potencia espiritual del pueblo coreano.
					
					  Los dos paises, China y Corea, son vecinos amistosos colindados con montanas y rios en el medio.
					
					  La amistad entre China y Corea tiene larga historia y tradiciones.
					
					  El Presidente Kim Il Sung forjo la amistad entre los dos paises junto con su homologo Mao Zedong, el premier Zhou Enlai y otros revolucionarios chinos de veterana generacion.
					
					  En los periodos de la guerra antijaponesa y la coreana, los ejercitos y los pueblos de ambos paises obtuvieron fulminante victoria combatiendo hombro con hombro.
					
					  Los dos paises han acelerado la construccion del socialismo apoyandose y cooperando mutuamente.
					
					  Consolidar y desarrollar incesantemente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre China y Corea devienen sagrado deber de ambos pueblos.
					
					  Bajo la profunda atencion de los maximos dirigentes de ambos paises, la amistad China-Corea se desarrolla cada dia mas favorablemente.
					
					  Se realizan activamente el intercambio y la cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					  Estoy seguro de la eternidad de la amistad China-Corea.

articles.title: Alumnos conmemoran aniversario 55 de obra de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Alumnos conmemoran aniversario 55 de obra de Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 55o aniversario de la publicacion de la obra maestra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "Ojala que un segundo dure una hora", tuvo lugar el dia 13 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el recital de poesias y canciones de los ninos escolares.
					  Ante todo, fue recitada esa poesia que compuso el Dirigente deseando la buena salud del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien trabajaba incansablemente durante el periodo de la reconstruccion posbelica.
					
					  Luego, se pusieron a la ejecucion el coro "Deseamos la seguridad del General", el poema recitado por 3 ninos "Un segundo y una hora de anoranza", la poesia y coro femenino "Si fuera el reloj de pared en la oficina del General", etc.
					
					  La cancion acompanada de Oungum (instrumento musical coreano) "La pisada del General", el poema y cancion acompanada de Kayagum (instrumento coreano de cuerdas) "Chollima de la Corea del Songun vuela en alto", el coro "La carta de bendicion que dedican 3 millones" y otras piezas mostraron la feliz y alegre vida de los ejecutantes, quienes crecen aprendiendo a sus anchas y abrigando grandes esperanzas en el regazo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, y su voluntad de prepararse como futuros trabajadores protagonistas de la gran potencia prospera.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun llama a la victoria de la campana de 100 dias
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun llama a la victoria de la campana de 100 dias
 Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En un editorial difundido este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun exhorta a todos a luchar dinamicamente por la victoria de la campana de 100 dias bajo la bandera de autoconfianza uniendose monoliticamente en torno a la Direccion de la Revolucion encabezada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					  El espiritu de autoconfianza y perseverancia es la poderosa arma ideologica del pueblo coreano que ha recorrido siempre la senda de victorias y glorias bajo la direccion del gran lider y el gran partido, subraya el editorial y continua:
					
					  Es muy enorme la tarea de lucha que tenemos que cumplir para alcanzar la meta de construccion de una gran potencia prospera y no son pocas las cosas que nos escasean.
					
					Pero, no hay nada imposible si nos levantamos confiando en nuestras propias fuerzas. 
					
					Ademas, contamos con la unidad monolitica de todo el ejercito y el pueblo en torno al partido, la gran potencia espiritual que desconoce lo imposible, el superior sistema social y la solida base de la economia autarquica consolidada en medio de duras pruebas.
					
					  Cuando luchemos a nuestra manera movilizando nuestro poderio politico-ideologico y apoyandonos en las potencialidades de la economia nacional, podremos pasar con dignidad las puertas a la gran potencia prospera.
					
					  La campana de 100 dias de hoy es la ofensiva final para registrar este ano como el de grandes cambios, digno de anotarse en letras doradas en los anales de la patria. La extraordinaria importancia de esa campana esta en que ella se trata de la ofensiva para lograr un triunfo mas grande en el proximo ano, en que se cumplira el 65o aniversario de la fundacion del partido, y para preparar el trampolin que nos haga pasar en 2012 las puertas a la gran potencia prospera. 
					
					　Para llegar a toda costa este ano al punto de viraje en la construccion de una gran potencia prospera, no tenemos otro remedio que apoyarnos en las propias fuerzas. He aqui la victoria de la ofensiva general de hoy y el futuro de la gran potencia prospera.
					
					  La fe independiente, el coraje incomparable y el inflexible espiritu de la marcha forzada del Dirigente Kim Jong Il sirven de la fuerza motriz que incrementa mil veces el espiritu revolucionario de autoconfianza y de lucha tenaz de nuestro ejercito y pueblo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun se refiere a la cooperacion Sur-Sur
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun se refiere a la cooperacion Sur-Sur
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El rotativo Rodong Sinmun, en un articulo individual difundido el dia 14 senala que para los paises en vias de desarrollo la cooperacion Sur-Sur es uno de los medios fundamentales para superar las actuales dificultades y establecer el nuevo orden economico internacional imparcial e igual.
					La ampliacion e intensificacion de la cooperacion Sur-Sur permiten poner fin a la explotacion y saqueo neocolonial de los imperialistas y cambiar radicalmente las relaciones economicas con los paises desarrollados, subraya el articulista y continua:
					
					Aunque es debil la capacidad economica de los paises en vias de desarrollo, sera consolidada notablemente si estos paises amplian y desarrollan la cooperacion y el intercambio materializando el principio de autoconfianza colectiva, lo cual impulsara energicamente el  establecimiento del nuevo orden economico internacional y el desarrollo economico de ellos.
					
					La expansion y fortalecimiento de la cooperacion Sur-Sur hacen intensificar la amistad y la solidaridad entre los paises en vias de desarrollo y elevar su poderio y papal.
					
					Si estos paises amplian y desarrollan la cooperacion e intercambio multilaterales realizando el intercambio mutuamente beneficioso, se podran estrechar aun mas sus vinculos.
					
					Si ellos cooperan estrechamente en lo economico y en lo tecnico sobre el principio de la autoconfianza colectiva y se unen solidamente en lo politico para enfrentarse con el caduco orden economico internacional a traves de la lucha comun, los imperialistas, cuya linea vital es la explotacion y el saqueo sobre los paises en vias de desarrollo, se encontraran en el aprieto, lo que podra crear el ambiente favorable al establecimiento del nuevo orden economico internacional.
					
					 Cuanto mas los paises en vias de desarrollo  amplian y desarrollan la cooperacion Sur-Sur, tanto mas se adelantara el establecimiento del nuevo orden en cuestion y se lograra el gran avance en su lucha por el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad.
